body: Oh, so i wait no authorship?  :worried:
Ah! this is #1113 with #1127 applied. Closing.
Closing as fixed in #1084
Really sorry. My mistake
#694 was merged into master.  I'm dealing with the merge conflicts in this branch and will push something shortly.

I've found myself in an endless loop of git rebase in order to try to deal with these branch conflicts but I'm afraid I'm making a bigger mess.  If it is simpler to close this PR and have me open another I'm happy to do that.
@dennisobrien do whatever you feel more comfortable with :)
Better install caravel inside a virtualenv created with python3.4+ . If you can't do that python2.7 should be fine. Don't mess install python libraries in system python.
I met the same issue, does anyone knows how to solve it? thx.

@FrankXfs we can reopen the issue if you have a stacktrace, can reproduce on master and you report your database connection uri. Also please double check that's your stacktrace is not the same of #464.
Which version is this? If that's not master possibly it has already been fixed there.
Official from pip (so I assume it's 0.10.0)
@maver1ck could you please try to reproduce in master please? If that's a production instance don't upgrade there though :)
So it looks like it's on purpose since the examples table are created there. A bit puzzled that i don't have it on my production install but no big deal. Closing then.

Closing this PR and starting a clean PR.

I closed PR #1092 and opened a cleaner PR #1137 

(This seemed easier than dealing with all the merge conflicts from recently pulled changes in master.)
which version of caravel are you using? If not master please test master before opening any issue.
I'm using `0.10.0`. Apologies for any confusion: are you saying users should clone the repo and install from source before opening an issue?
@amancevice yes, please! that would help a lot.

Are there instructions for doing this? 

When I follow the directions [here](http://airbnb.io/caravel/installation.html), substituting `pip install caravel` with `pip install -e <path/to/repo>` I get all sorts of CSS issues. I'm sure I'm just missing some step.
https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/blob/master/docs/installation.rst#making-your-own-build
Thanks!
It looks like this is indeed fixed in master -- I wait with bated breath for `pip install 'caravel>0.10.0'` to succeed :)
Has anyone found a way around this?
Nice! great work!
LGTM !
Rogue merging this PR. I'll sort things out around async mode in upcoming PRs.

I can edit query but there is no execute query button :)

I'm not sure if it's in-scope for this PR (tell me what you think!), but I was thinking about where all the new methods/functions around the results should live, and I like the idea to organize all this around of a `CaravelDataFrame` that would derive `pandas.DataFrame` and add the type inference methods to it.

Eventually we can migrate more results related transformations to that class.
what's your npm version? for the record mine is `3.10.5`

@mistercrunch can you let me know your comment on my PR as soon as you can? I didn't see any for src_register. I'll be able to response fast. It takes a lot of extra effort to maintain the PR to be updated with master. Thanks in advance.
oh, it's too low than you, I will try your version, thanks

Oh, go to the database edit page and check "enable in SQL Lab" and "Allow Run Sync" Things should settle very soon and we'll release `0.11.0`

Seems like there's a solution here:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23347387/x-forwarded-proto-and-flask

I'd approve a PR that would add `ENABLE_PROXY_FIX = False` to `caravel/config.py` and:

```
if config.get('ENABLE_PROXY_FIX'):
    app.wsgi_app = ProxyFix(app.wsgi_app)
```

to `caravel/__init__.py`

OK. Working :)

But could you try this scenario:
1. Add Database
2. Check only 'Expose in SQL Lab'
3. Go to SQL Lab
4. From dropdown select any table from this database 
5. Click on table 'Run query in new tab' (blue sign on top with '+')

The query is executed. Should it be this way ?
@maver1ck #1141 is probably easy to fix as some variable is used but not defined, maybe a typo?

I'll try to work on this today.
This will be my first contribution to Caravel so please be patient.
Are you sure this depends on timezone conversion? Anyway looks like a dup of https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/issues/763
PTAL @vera-liu @mistercrunch @bkyryliuk @williaster
closing this in favor of this PR: https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/pull/1074

@mistercrunch Thanks for pointing that out.  I've submitted a PR (https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/pull/1150) that adds the ProxyFix support.  We just deployed 0.10.0 with that commit cherry-picked and confirmed we're no longer being redirected from https to http.

it would be great to have test coverage for sql lab. should we start adding tests as we make changes, or do you have plans to tackle that @mistercrunch?

taking a closer look here, i'm not sure we need the popover to show the url since the user doesn't need to select it. could the subnav item be the copy link it self, swapping the link icon for the copy to clipboard icon? it also seems like too many popover like things all together... would be nice to simplify...

It's not so easy for me.
I tried to do following:

```
--- a/caravel/models.py
+++ b/caravel/models.py
@@ -289,9 +289,13 @@ def set_perm(mapper, connection, target):  # noqa
     elif target.druid_datasource_id:
         src_class = DruidDatasource
         id_ = target.druid_datasource_id
+    else:
+        flasher("Can't remove {} datasource with active slices".format(target.datasource_name), "danger")
+        return
     ds = db.session.query(src_class).filter_by(id=int(id_)).first()
     target.perm = ds.perm
```

But result is that I'm getting as many warning as slice count :>

I'm looking deeper into SQL Alchemy ORM (this is trigger on cascade delete)
LGTM

Added specs and endpoint test, made more modifications 
@mistercrunch @ascott @bkyryliuk
@mistercrunch !

Please note that #1078 will change things quite a bit around this code. The correct fix i think would be to add a signal handler for the deletion of SqlaTable or DruidDatasource and block the deletion if there are slices. We are losing the FK so we cannot do that in sqlalchemy.

this maybe coursed by some field type in you data table exceed the caravel table:table_columns,field:type 's size limit 
I used MySQL: error when add table.
(1406, "Data too long for column 'type' at row 1") [SQL: 'INSERT INTO table_columns (created_on, changed_on, table_id, column_name, verbose_name, is_dttm, is_active, type, groupby, count_distinct, sum, max, min, filterable, expression, description, python_date_format, database_expression, created_by_fk, changed_by_fk) VALU
Anyone can dealing this? Thank you very much.

Oh nice! I didn't see your updates since my last comment. I'm a bit overwhelmed with the amount of notifications and communication channels around me.

in the mean time @vera-liu let's merge!
